alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Inland Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:34AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Gulf and south central Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 1015 AM CDT... At 934 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wewahitchka, or 17 miles east of Callaway, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stonemill Creek, Wewahitchka and Chipola Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
